reviews.text:
A comprehensive museum about the Jacobite steam train at the stop about half an hour from Fort William. On the steam train ride there is about 20 minutes here to get off the train and visit the museum on the outward bound part of the journey.
The gift shop on the station also offers Harry Potter items. There is a car park for people visiting who are not on the train trip
Great little museum, station and trail to view the famous viaduct. Friendly staff and although we didn't visit the wee carriage restaurant looked brilliant! Definitely worth a visit.
Bucket list! Interesting simulation of signalling in ex-signalbox. Might try restaurant car if ever driving to take alternative photos.
Was in the area and was ready for a wee bit of lunch, very clean and comfortable surroundings, real quality home made food, and the staff are lovely. Will definitely be going back again.

Sociable and knowledgeable staff.  Used here to park but fiven info to get to the best  viewing point foe the Harry Potter Steam train at Glenfinnan Viaduct.   Very good tea and cakes in the dining car too.  Also interesting exhibition on the building of the viaduct
